Posts.Content: On Sep 08, 2010 5:22 PM rlinda7358 wrote: On Sep 08, 2010 5:17 AM Michelle49 wrote: On Sep 07, 2010 1:08 AM lisa8282 wrote: Hi!  I have inflammatory breast cancer.  Is there anyone else on here that has it too?  I feel so alone, I have yet to talk with anyone else who has this rare cancer.    Hope to find someone soon.   Lisa I don't know if mine is the same, but I have infiltrating carcinoma of the breast which has spread to my bones.  I have been staged at IVb.  I would be glad to talk to you even if our cancers aren't exactly the same.  I'm not sure how this works as I just stumbled upon this website, but I'm assuming that I would get an email notification from you.  I will pray for you Lisa whether you contact me or not.  Michelle :) Hi!I am just diagnosed with breast cancer and am scared..I want to get some info re-breast cancer..Tomorrow i am scheduled to see the oncologist..I don't know what to expect but hope i can get some advice from you re-breast cancer  experienced ..I praying for all of us who happens to have this BC..May God protect us..GOD BLESS! I am sorry that it's taken me so long to reply.  I completely understand your feeling of fear.  I have what I believe to be an excellent oncologist after seeing two that I was completely uncomfortable and unhappy with.  I live in the Denver, Colorado area.  Where are you located?  Can you share with me what happened at your visit and maybe we can go from there with what I have experienced so far and what you might expect?  Is this feeling too personal for you?  The reason I'm asking is because quite honestly I don't know exactly where to begin in telling you what to expect.  I am willing to tell you anything and everything I can to help you.  If this forum is too public for you, perhaps there's a way to communicate via email.  Otherwise, this is fine with me.  Are you feeling as scared as you were, or was your oncologist able to explain things and give you some reassurance?  How are you doing emotionally?  I am a Christian and believe fully in God's presence, power to heal, and ability to give us peace.  The bible says Jesus is the Prince of Peace.  I will be praying for you.  Even though God knows who you are, I wish I could pray for you by name.  None the less, you are now in my prayers!  God Bless You!  Michelle
Posts.Title: inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: On Sep 07, 2010 1:08 AM lisa8282 wrote: Hi!  I have inflammatory breast cancer.  Is there anyone else on here that has it too?  I feel so alone, I have yet to talk with anyone else who has this rare cancer.    Hope to find someone soon.   Lisa I don't know if mine is the same, but I have infiltrating carcinoma of the breast which has spread to my bones.  I have been staged at IVb.  I would be glad to talk to you even if our cancers aren't exactly the same.  I'm not sure how this works as I just stumbled upon this website, but I'm assuming that I would get an email notification from you.  I will pray for you Lisa whether you contact me or not.  Michelle :)
